intro: Pimpinella olenea, commonly known as the narrowleaf cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps, which release tiny seeds when mature. Pimpinella olenea is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its ecological importance to pollinators.
